page.title: 17The M62 Motorway
page.content: We visited the Highway Maintence department of the Wakefield Metropolitan District council.Mr Steeper told us that it was in 1936 when the idea for a motorway system was born.The M62 crosses the country from east to west and forms a letter H with the A1 & M1.The M62 was not started at one end and continued to the other.It was completed in sections so that some parts were in use before others.The first part of the M62 to be built was in the Pennines in 1967.Detailed plans for the stretch of the M62 between intersections 32 & 33 began in 1960.Between intersections 32 and 33 work began in 1972 & finished in 1974.Between the intersections 32 and 33 the road was affected by mining subsidence.We saw photographs of crack damage to bridges on our stretch of motorway.
